intro: Merinthopodium leucanthum, commonly known as the white-flowered merinthopodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is typically found in moist, rocky habitats and is often seen growing in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
